intro: Laserpitium peucedanoides, commonly known as the common cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its biennial life cycle, with the first year spent as a basal rosette and the second year producing a flowering stem. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
